thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Tuesday

author: news.com.au
title: Stocks to watch on Tuesday
text:
STOCKS to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Tuesday, Aug 11:
BKN - BRADKEN - down 2.00 cents, or 1.80 per cent, at $1.09
Mining services group Bradken believes it is well placed for a turnaround in the sector after a major restructure and a full year loss of more than $240 million. COH - COCHLEAR - down $10.91, or 12.12 per cent, at $79.13 Shares in the company behind the Cochlear implant have fallen sharply with investors disappointed by a 56 per cent rise in annual profit. DMP - DOMINO'S PIZZA - down $2.49, or 6.05 per cent, at $38.66 Domino's Pizza shares fell despite the company's 40 per cent profit growth to $64 million beating its guidance. GXL - GREENCROSS - up 79.00 cents, or 13.21 per cent, at $6.77 Petcare specialist Greencross has returned to profit after a 75 per cent increase in revenue due to the expansion of its retail and veterinary network. LNC - LINC ENERGY - up 1.69 cents, or 3.03 per cent, at 57.44 cents Linc Energy has defended itself against serious pollution allegations, saying there's little evidence Queensland government workers became sick from contaminants from an underground coal gasification plant. PDN - PALADIN ENERGY - up 2.00 cents, or 11.11 per cent, at 20.00 cents Uranium miner Paladin Energy is searching for a chief executive after the sudden departure of John Borshoff. TCL - TRANSURBAN GROUP - down 21.00 cents, or 2.07 per cent, at $9.91 Transurban plans to lift payouts to investors as the company further integrates assets from Queensland Motorways Group, an acquisition that pushed it into the red. WOR - WORLEYPARSONS - down 18.00 cents, or 2.07 per cent, at $8.51 Engineering construction group WorleyParsons is facing a $200 million goodwill assets writedown.
